title: MySQLRPAD()Function

metadata.description: Learn about MySQLRPAD()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example
Right-pad the string with "ABC", to a total length of 20:
SELECT RPAD("SQL Tutorial", 
  20, "ABC");

Definition and Usage
The RPAD() function right-pads a string with another string, to a certain 
length.
Note:
Also look at the
LPAD()
function.
Syntax
RPAD(
string
,
length
,
rpad_string
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
string
Required. The original string. If the length of the original string is 
    larger than the
length
parameter, this function removes the overfloating characters from
string
length
Required. The length of the string after it has been right-padded
rpad_string
Required. The string to right-pad to
string
Technical Details
Works in:
From MySQL 4.0
More Examples
Example
Right-pad the text in "CustomerName" with "ABC", to a total length of 30:
SELECT 
  RPAD(CustomerName, 30, "ABC") AS RightPadCustomerName
FROM Customers;

★
+1

quiz.question: What is If the length of the original string?
quiz.explanation:
The correct definition of If the length of the original string is 'larger than the
length
parameter'.

quiz.question: Which best describes the main purpose of this c feature?
quiz.explanation: This feature serves multiple purposes in software development.

summary: This tutorial covers MySQLRPAD()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use MySQLRPAD()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of MySQLRPAD()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
